Message.Title: "your little book"
Message.Msg: it's one thing for our home grown lefties to trash the constitution of the United States. We're used to it. It's quite another to have some snooty arrogant Brit like Piers Morgan to trash it as he did last night when during his anti second amendment debate he referred to the constitution as "your little book." Americans don't like that.

Topic.Title: Do they really believe they can regulate a citizens constitutional right by executive order?

Message.Msg: Actually, yes, they can. FDR originally prevented Americans from owning gold by an executive order that was later written into law.

Topic.Title: hey you phony self righteous teagag strict constitutionalists: muskets were the weapons of the founders

Topic.Title: Do they really believe they can regulate a citizens constitutional right by executive order?

Message.Msg: Such confusion... you're comparing apples to oranges..... No where in the Constitution does it directly say that citizens have a right to own gold The Constitution does however grant a right of gun ownership that shall not be infringed Its really hard to for me to comprehend that liberals can't understand a simple phrase.... The right to bear arms shall not be infringed.... tell me how you interpret that any different from what it actually says

Message.Title: avenport Upgrades to Buy - a few words before you run and buy the stock.
Message.Msg: I opened the recommendation and had TipRanks installed.. here is the data that popped on my screen: 1) the Analyst behind the upgrade is Drake Johnstone of Davenport & Co 2) his average return on each Buy/Sell rating since 2009 is -10.7% (under the S&P500) 3) his success rate is 38% (only 3 out of 8 recommendations actually outperformed the market) So i wouldnt take what he says very far and put my money on it.

Topic.Title: a musket , a powder horn and some balls

Message.Msg: More directly, Obama has killed over 1540 Americans in Afganistan (71% of all American deaths there since the turn of the century).

The best reaction is via our pocketbooks --- I no longer buy Ben &Jerry's ice cream or watch Sean Penn movies, as an example. To all --- regardless of your political party, just quit buying this paper.

Topic.Title: NY Gov Cuomo set to announce proposal for new gun laws

Message.Msg: I live here in Chicago and trust me, on an average weekend night there are over 100 reported shooting attempts, but their aim is so bad they usually only hit about 10%, and we have arguably the toughest gun laws in the country. Basically the laws here assure the gangs and other miscreants that they will be in a risk-free zone if they start popping off bullets in a neighborhood as long as there are no po-po around.

Message.Title: Nanny Bloomberg...
Message.Msg: now wants to restrict the administerng of pain killers to patients in the hospital by doctors. There is no end to what this guy wants to restrict. I understand that pain killers can be an addictive problem. Nonetheless, such decisions are between the patient and the doctor. Bloomberg should butt out.

Topic.Title: Barack Obama dropped ouit of Communisim Class while at Columbia University!

Message.Msg: But that was when he was a foreign student, so all bets may be off.

His motive might be to stop doctors from being enablers such as in the cases of Michael Jackson, Anna Nicole Smith, Whitney Houston, Elvis Presley. Nonetheless, this is why doctors have malpractice insurance. The Gov can't regulate medical advice. A person in constant pain from back or neck injuries gets addicted, so what. However, It's not always that a doctor knows the risks of long term use of prescription drugs. I learned that with a doc who kept prescribing statins to my father and they made him act like he was drunk all the time, babbling, couldn't gather his thoughts. The attitude was that's all there is. Not so.

There are already Federal regulations on this, so what's Bloomie's problem? Somebody might be 90 years old and dying of cancer and the Feds are worried that he might become addicted to opiates. And the real questions is, "So what he does?"
